instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: Clean board, green light but no orange light and no S5 rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message:
History fault, any sign of liquid, or dropped?

You must get orange light even without battery; check that.
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 (two) charger 60/85W.

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 voltages.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> and post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message:
No liquid clean board, no drops. Green light seem to come on sometimes, now with good know charger not green or orange light at all. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.27v 
PP3V42 3.426v 
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 0v [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> Vin Pin 23 12.27 Enable Pins 4,21,12 all are 0v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: PPBUS is too low should be 12.56. Corrosion near or under it? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: Thanks, I just learned that ppbus should be 12.56, there is no corrosion on this board, looks clean, [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.392v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> 
Pin 1 3.42
Pin 2 0
Pin 3 3.42
Pin 4 2.78
Pin 5 3.392
Pin 6 3.4
Pin 7 3.42
Pin 8 3.29

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: Reflow the SMC. If no change, likely bad SMC or bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. My guess is crap under SMC causing issue and reflow will fix it, but hard to say.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: That was the first thing I did before posting here, but no luck, I will try again one more time and post back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message:
Reflow is wasting time now.
Reball SMC and change it, if no luck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message:
Ok SMC had some concentrated corrosion on pin 117 so bad that the pad was gone from both the board and the chip, reballing my first SMC went perfect, first try and all went well, I ran a wire to the pad on the board and solder the SMC again, but same problem.

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will the SMC from that board work on this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: Any recommendation on where to get donor boards that may have good SMC chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
And be sure pad and trace correctly rebuilt...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light but no orange light and no S5 rails
threads.message: I ran a wire from <CAPACITOR>C5005</CAPACITOR> to pin 117 on the board
